captions.text:
From the studio dumb enough to sell their
Marvel franchise rights to Disney

comes yet another movie that only exists to
set up The Avengers.

So stand tall for a superhero movie with an
important message:
It’s what’s on the inside that counts.
Except for when it comes to fighting,
"Look at that. He's making me cry."

"Women aren't exactly linin' up to dance with
a guy they might step on."
Meet Johnny Storm, the Human Torch --
Wait, no, that's the wrong movie.

Meet Steve Rodgers, a grown man’s head CGI’d
onto a little boy’s body.

He’s a skinny kid from Brooklyn who dresses
like it’s the 1940’s.
So basically a modern day kid from Brooklyn.

Watch as he becomes a superhero in the most
American way possible:

He’ll juice up to become Captain America,
a soldier with the powers of...

Being a little bit stronger than a regular
strong guy,

Forget Tony’s ridiculous 3D holograms, return
to an analogue world full of

and people calling out percentages with absolutely
no context.

Ride along with Captain America as he faces
off against the evil Red Skull,

Who along with everyone else in sci-fi and
fantasy is played by Hugo Weaving.

Cheer as the Captain defeats his legendary
arch-nemesis
All to leave more time for

Unnecessarily freezing himself so he can be
in

And an after credits scene that is literally
a trailer for
One Face Two Face Red Face Ew Face
Captain America: The First Avenger...'s trailer.
Raiders of the Lost Ark did it better.

Hey Screen Junkies, can't get enough of my
buttery voice? Then check out Honest Game

Trailers over on Smosh Games. How's that for
a slice of fried gold?

comments.text:
Anyone else notice that Schmidt (which sounds German for Smith so go figure 
ha ha) doesn't sound German 98% of the time?  He mainly just sounds like 
his totally average everyday British self with a few words meant to sound 
German.  I mean come on, not that I didn't think he was great though.  Why 
is it that most actors sound British when trying to do other European 
accents?﻿
